q: Jefferies feels that the move by Google to switch Eric Schmidt to Executive Chairman for CEO could not have come at a better time with such a strong last quarter. They are a little skeptic and state that, it does introduce a level of uncertainty around execution under the new leadership, particularly considering the growing competitive landscape.

"he jumped" and "won't stay that long" at the company. He Was Pushed Eric Schmidt stepping down creates a "huge advantage" for Google, writes Danny Sullivan at Search Engine Land. If Page is stepping up as the public face, it's an opportunity to defuse or put some of the gaffes associated with Eric Schmidt behind the company. Page carries virtually no such baggage.
